JOURNEY

CHURCH

Our Story

The summer of 2010 was a rough one. Kate and I had recently moved across the country to start a new church. I was originally from Louisiana and my wife was from Nashville, TN. We met in Haiti (you know typical story). I had just finished a seminary degree at Liberty University and we were praying where God would send us. We felt called to California and ended up picking Sacramento. Within the first couple months we had our trailer stolen, we couldn’t afford one piece of furniture, and we were sleeping on a blow up mattress with a hole in it also known as the floor. We thought we were being faithful to what God had called us to but really had no clue what we were doing. It started a pretty tough time in our pretty new marriage. That night I cried into my pillow and vowed never to plant a church again.

In May of 2013 I was working for a company that opened a new office in Oceanside, CA and we moved. A few months in we met a guy named Jim Britts who was starting a new church called Parkside. We had been through this church plant thing before and weren’t too excited about it. We went to their first official service on Easter 2014 and knew God was calling us there.

We have seen God’s favor and grace displayed not only in our lives but the lives of hundreds of people at Parkside for the last 3 years. I became the Connections Pastor at Parkside and we are so thankful for what God has done in our lives, but it wasn’t over. In 2016 God began putting it on our hearts to plant a church again in the community that we love so much – Oceanside, CA.

We are calling it Journey Church because we have seen that no matter where you are in your journey God will meet you there. He met us in His perfect timing and we are looking forward to many others sharing the story of when God entered their journey in life. We are thrilled that God is already building an incredible team of people to help start Journey. We believe the transcript of our prayers will become the script of our church and are excited about what God is going to do.

Our Vision

Restoring hope in North County by meeting people in their journey and introducing them to the love of Jesus

Our Values

Restore broken journeys

Where people's journeys meet Jesus' story

Develop Real Community

Where It's Okay not to be Okay

Write Our Story
through Prayer

The transcript of our prayers become the script of our lives

Serve North County Sacrificially

We give because He gave
